messages.subject: Re: Habbo Hotel?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kristen, that sounds about right, but I can remember when £9 would have been around $18. Elaine (UK) Have been no mail for a while and then forgot I was no
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kristen,
that sounds about right, but I can remember when �9 would have
been around $18.

Elaine (UK)

Have been no mail for a while and then forgot I was no mail, I've just
remembered! Doh!


>The currency is in British Pounds.

>I tried one of the currency exchanges on line to make sure, but is 9
> >British
Pounds really $14??

>Thanks!
>Kristen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?
messages.msgSnippet: LOL We tend to find Math in just about everything.  The kids even like to figure out our grocery bill as we shop. The winner doesn t have to unload the van.
messages.messageBody:
LOL We tend to find Math in just about everything. The kids even like to figure out our grocery bill as we shop. The winner doesn't have to unload the van. lol They made up that game a couple years ago. -- The things they do.

Kathy Sullivan:
Mom to Logan 15, Andrew 10, Alexander 6 1/2, and Christopher David 14 months.

"Some people think that we put our lives on hold to raise a child, but we know that to hold a child IS life"

"To be free to learn, children must be free to dream!"

----- Original Message -----
From: Have a Nice Day!
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, December 16, 2002 4:03 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?


THats the site we used. I just wanted to make sure I did it right.

Great math day, huh??

LOL
Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: Kathy Sullivan
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, December 16, 2002 4:28 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?


Great website for The Universal Currency Converter http://www.xe.net/ucc/ HTH.

Kathy Sullivan:
Mom to Logan 15, Andrew 10, Alexander 6 1/2, and Christopher David 14 months.

"Some people think that we put our lives on hold to raise a child, but we know that to hold a child IS life"

"To be free to learn, children must be free to dream!"



----- Original Message -----
From: Have a Nice Day!
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, December 16, 2002 3:17 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?


Does anyone else have kids who like to go to Habbo Hotel?

My kids love it and my daughter requested a "splash tastic card" in order to *buy* credits to furnish her virtual rooms.
It looks like its a pre-pay debit card, so no danger of getting in debt.

The currency is in British Pounds.

I tried one of the currency exchanges on line to make sure, but is 9 British Pounds really $14??

Thanks!
Kristen

****************************************************************

Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.

Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better than yesterday.

The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/16/02 2:25:57 PM, DCOLB@cfl.rr.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/16/02 2:25:57 PM, DCOLB@... writes:

<< I tried one of the currency exchanges on line to make sure, but is 9
British Pounds really $14?? >>

I was just on the phone to my friend in London who said she was looking at
houses to buy but she was unwilling to spend 200,000 pounds ($300,000, she
quickly translated, and roughly, I guess) on a 1300 square foot house.

When we were there a few years back, Holly's allowance was $6.75 and that was
four one-pound coins in her reckoning (which I don't hesitate to trust).

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Habbo Hotel?
messages.msgSnippet: I tried one of the currency exchanges on line to make sure, but is 9 British Pounds really $14?? It wouldn t surprise me a bit. My dearest friend is Scottish
messages.messageBody:
I tried one of the currency exchanges on line to make sure, but is 9 British Pounds really $14??

It wouldn't surprise me a bit. My dearest friend is Scottish and I am always a little amazed when she translates something from pounds to dollars for me.
It was pretty funny to see one of the most intelligent people I know try to figure out our change when she was here:)
Denese

Thanks!
Kristen

****************************************************************

Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.

Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better than yesterday.

The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.
